chapter.title: Integration of external repositories
chapter.para: Sometimes it might be necessary to add external repositories, e.g. when testing an application which is developed for the &ucsUAS;. Such components can be registered via &ucsUMC; or in &ucsUCR;.
Components can be versioned. This ensures that only components are installed that are compatible with a UCS version.

listitem.simpara: The current major-minor version will be used. If for example UCS 5.2 is installed, only the `5.2` repository will be used. Please note that all major and minor updates will be blocked until the component is available for the new release. Patch level and errata updates are not affected. If for example UCS-5.1 is currently installed and UCS-5.2 or UCS-6.0 are already available, the release updated will be postponed until the component is also available for version 5.2 and 6.0 respectively.

By specifying an explicit version number only the specified version of the component will be used if it matches the current UCS version. Release updates of the system will not be hindered by such components. Multiple versions can be given using commas as delimiters. For example 5.1 5.2 would only include the component with UCS 5.1 and 5.2 but not if UCS 5.0 or UCS 5.3 is in use.

section.title: Integration of repository components via &ucsUMC;
section.para: A list of the integrated repository components is in the UMC module Repository Settings. Applications which have been added via the Univention App Center are still listed here, but should be managed via the App Center module.

A further component can be set up with Add. The Component name identifies the component on the repository server. A free text can be entered under Description, for example, for describing the functions of the component in more detail.
The host name of the download server is to be entered in the input field Repository server, and, if necessary, an additional file path in Repository prefix.
A Username and Password can be configured for repository servers which require authentication.
A software component is only available once Enable this component has been activated.
A differentiation is made for components between maintained and unmaintained components.

section.title: Integration of repository components via Univention Configuration Registry
section.para: The following &ucsUCR; variables can be used to register a repository component. It is also possible to activate further functions here which cannot be configured via the UMC module. NAME stands for the component's name:

listitem.simpara: The repository server on which the components are available. If this variable is not set, the server from the &ucsUCRV; repository/online/server uses.
This variable must be set to enabled if the components are to be mounted.

This variable can be used to configure whether the component is mirrored locally. In combination with the &ucsUCRV; repository/online/component/NAME/server, a configuration can be set up so that the component is mirrored, but not activated, or that it is activated, but not mirrored.
A descriptive name for the repository.
Defines the URL prefix which is used on the repository server. This variable is usually not set.

Defines the type of the repository: arch (default) or flat. If flat repository is specified, the Packages file is searched within the root directory of the repository. If arch is set or the variable is unset, the Packages file is searched within the architecture subdirectories amd64/ resp. all/. This variable is usually not set.
If the repository server requires authentication, the user name can be entered in this variable.
If the repository server requires authentication, the password can be entered in this variable.
This variable controls the versions to include, see for details.

A list of package names separated by blanks. The UMC module Repository Settings offers the installation of this component if at least one of the packages is not installed. Specifying the package list eases the subsequent installation of components.
